Figma is growing our team of passionate people on a mission to make design accessible to all. Born on the Web, Figma helps entire product teams brainstorm, design and build better products — from start to finish. Whether it’s consolidating tools, simplifying workflows, or collaborating across teams and time zones, Figma makes the design process faster, more efficient, and fun while keeping everyone on the same page. From great products to long-lasting companies, we believe that nothing great is made alone—come make with us!Figma is looking for a Director, Sales Enablement to join our dynamic global  team of creatives, engineers, marketers, and brilliant business folks. The Sales Enablement Team is at the nexus of our go-to-market strategy, and as our Director, Sales Enablement, you will be a key architect to our growth.  In this role, you will accelerate the onboarding of newly hired reps, support our entire Sales team to meet and exceed attainment numbers, continue elevating the skills of our senior sales reps, and accelerate the overall ARR growth of Figma. You will lead a 10+ person global team, including other people-managers, and help us continue to build and grow a world-class Sales organization.
This is a full time role that can be held from one of our US hubs or remotely in the United States.
What you'll do at Figma:

You will support our continued growth and the evolution of our solutions offerings, we are seeing a highly motivated and experienced sales enablement leader with a strong sales or solutions consulting background to join our team.  
You will be in charge of the successful enablement of our global sales organization including sales reps, account managers, solutions architects, customer experience managers  and sales leadership
You will be responsible for our sales enablement strategy and helping us define and prioritize initiatives that will support our go to market strategies. 
You will build and lead a team that is responsible for:

Diagnosing what obstacles our teams are facing in selling Figma and making customers successful
Building repeatable sales motions, processes and playbooks that make us more effective as a team
Producing, curating and maintaining content to support our sales motions and playbooks
Program managing our ongoing sales trainings and sales programming (enablement calls, all hands, etc.) and owning our enablement calendar globally
Facilitating successful training sessions and sales programming 
Measuring the effectiveness of our selling motions in order to change and optimize our efforts

You will drive progress towardsKPIs such as:

New hire ramp and time to first deal
Sales team attainment
Customer retention and expansion
Feedback from Figma’s customer and user community on our sales engagements


We’d love to hear from you if you have:

4+ years of Leadership experience in a Saas environment
Experience as a sales or sales engineering leader who has effectively built teams for scale  
A desire to be a key architect for growth at one of the most exciting software companies of the current era
Deep experience with B2B sales, technology and helping to design new selling motions
Experience with helping sellers build deep customer relationships by continually delivering value
A deep understanding of sales methodologies such as Command of the Message and MEDDICC
A desire to lead from the front and demonstrate how to effectively build customer relationships and deliver results 
Success with mentoring, developing and recruiting top talent

While it’s not required, it’s an added plus if you also have:

Experience with both PLG (bottoms-up) and Enterprise (tops-down) selling
Experience building an enablement team previously
Knowledge of key enablement systems (Chorus/Gong, Workramp (or other LMS), etc.)

 
At Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.Pay Transparency Disclosure
